options: Try to sell the chicken.
The chicken is not the best dish on the menu.
The chicken won't be ready in time for dinner.
questions.explanation:
We're out of the chicken.

	"86" has other meanings, too. To "86" a customer from a restaurant or bar means to kick him or her out for good.

questions.text: Why does Restaurant Worker A say "behind you" to Restaurant Worker B?
questions.correct: to warn B, whose back is turned, not to bump into A
options: to assure B that his or her order is almost ready
to assure B that A  will back B up if there is an argument with a customer
to inform B that A is waiting behind B in a queue for cocktails from the bartender
questions.explanation:
to warn B, whose back is turned, not to bump into A.

	Since restaurant workers carry hot plates and other dangerous stuff, and since they move around quickly, they have to continually warn each other about their whereabouts.

questions.text: What is a "deuce" in restaurant lingo?
options: a two-dollar menu item
two waiters who work as a team
two chefs who work as a team
questions.explanation:
a table for two.

	In a waitress's station she might have four deuces, two four-tops, and a six-top.

questions.correct: an order that a waiter has forgotten to turn in to the kitchen
options: an order pad
a restaurant check that a customer has neglected to pay
a wad of tip money in a waiter's pocket
questions.explanation:
an order that a waiter has forgotten to turn in to the kitchen.

	If a waiter realizes that he/she has a pocket ticket, he/she must beg the cooks to put that order ahead of all the others so that the customer won't realize what has happened.

questions.text: What does it mean to "bus tables"?
options: to hurry customers along
to push two tables together
to wait on customers
questions.explanation:
to clear them.

	Bus tubs are those big greasy plastic tubs that buspeople and waiters use to collect dirty dishes. Depending on the restaurant, buspeople may also set the table for the next customers; in other places this is done by the server taking the order or while serving the food.

questions.text: What happens when a restaurant table "turns"?
questions.correct: One party leaves and another sits down.
options: A waiter goes off duty and another waiter takes his/her place.
A party of customers turns from pleasant to unpleasant.
A waiter clears plates from one course and sets down plates for the next course.
questions.explanation:
One party leaves and another sits down.

	Turning tables quickly is one way to make more tips.

	Waiters, bartenders, hosts, and bussers work in the front. Cooks and dishwashers work "in the back."

customers with sloppy table manners
cooks who purposefully work slowly as a form of revenge
